image.altText: A woman with brown hair holding a baby with three other children to the left

props.synopsis: Danielle Malseed moved to Mount Gambier thinking housing would be cheap and easy to find, as it had been in the past, but she ended up sleeping on a floor.

title.children: Homelessness rises as people move to regions assuming prices still low

image.altText: Showers spread through Melbourne on Friday as the first of two cold fronts arrived.

props.synopsis: This weekend will bring some of the coldest weather of the season, as a two-pronged pulse of polar air sweeps well north.

title.children: La Niña watch issued as eastern Australia braces for more rain, snow

image.altText: A man sitting in front of a poker machine. Two more poker machines are next to him.

props.synopsis: An advocacy group say financial pressures may be increasing problem gambling, as annual losses on pokies in SA exceed $1 billion for the first time.

title.children: SA's pokie losses surpass $1bn for first time

image.altText: Irish players Kayleigh Cronin, Grace Kelly, Amy Boyle-Carr and Niamh Kelly sitting on a lounge.

props.synopsis: The Adelaide Crows' squad for the AFLW campaign will have a pronounced Irish brogue, with four players hailing from the Emerald Isle — and while they've joked about the accent barrier, they believe it's their Gaelic footy skills that will best translate in their new surrounds.

title.children: Irish quartet to help Adelaide Crows push for AFLW glory

image.altText: Students in the classroom at Mistake Creek State School.

props.synopsis: There's a bunch of factors behind a persistent divide in educational levels of urban and regional students. Teacher shortages are one part of the problem.

title.children: The city-country education divide driven by 'wicked policy problem'

image.altText: Emma Rebellato in South Australia

props.synopsis: I've lived away from South Australia for almost three years now, and coming home to see the algal bloom hit home.

title.children: How going home to see the algal bloom struck a personal chord

image.altText: A 4WD car with 'help' spelt out in yellow tape on its boot.

props.synopsis: When Caleb Humphries's car broke down on the Nullarbor Plain, he spent two days watching cars drive past him and hoping someone would stop, until help was sent from more than 1,200 kilometres away.

title.children: 'Shameful': For two days, no-one stopped to help stranded desert driver

image.altText: A young man wearing a paramedic uniform standing with his hands clasped in front of an ambulance and old building.

props.synopsis: As the NSW government announces a series of new ambulance stations across the state, a Broken Hill paramedics union delegate says their station is well overdue for an update to help accommodate an influx of staff.

title.children: Push to upgrade outback ambo station that has asbestos, broken urinal

image.altText: Collage of acts playing Adelaide's Harvest Rock 2025 lineup.

props.synopsis: Back after a rough year off, the two-day festival sees The Strokes, Jelly Roll and The War On Drugs mix it up with a host of impressive homegrown acts.

title.children: Adelaide's Harvest Rock festival revived with bumper 2025 line-up

image.altText: A crowd of people gather under a lot of flags at a climate conference.

props.synopsis: Australia's bid to host next year's UN climate conference in Adelaide is taking longer than expected, raising concerns about preparations for an event described as the country's "biggest since the 2000 Olympics in Sydney".

title.children: 'Runway getting shorter' for Australia's COP31 ambitions as Türkiye holds firm

image.altText: Flames and smoke from a building on Hindley Street.

props.synopsis: A fire that ripped through a food business on Hindley Street is believed to have started in a deep fryer, with the Metropolitan Fire Service saying early indications suggest a damage bill of up to $400,000.

title.children: Adelaide CBD fire sends flames 'blasting' onto Hindley Street

image.altText: A man with short brown hair wearing a red and blue checkered shirt speaks with his hands in front of a courthouse

props.synopsis: Mike Worsman was aged 12 when he was sexually abused in the 1990s in Canberra. He says the system's let him down.

title.children: 'Mere 16 months of peace': Survivor angered by abuser's sentence

image.altText: A young man in a black shirt signing a piece of paper with a small blue flag with a club logo on it in front of him.

props.synopsis: Mount Gambier's Bae Versace has achieved his dream by signing with a European football club, the youth division of FK Budućnost Podgorica in the Balkan capital of Montenegro.

title.children: Soccer player from Mt Gambier snapped up by European club

image.altText: A graphic shows gummies, social media photos about creatine and has text in the middle saying 'should I be taking creatine!?"

props.synopsis: Health experts say we are in the midst of a creatine craze, but independent tests show some expensive gummy brands contain next to no creatine.

title.children: Dietitians warn creatine craze is not for everyone

image.altText: Chinese and Australian flags at an event in Shanghai

props.synopsis: The extensive statement from China's state security ministry accuses Australian leaders of deliberately pushing a false story about the threat Beijing poses to the country.

title.children: China claims it has foiled Australian spies on its shores in stinging rebuke

image.altText: Jim Chalmers

props.synopsis: As the roundtable nears, the list of ideas has grown longer, more ambitious and often contradictory.

title.children: Tinkering at the edges of productivity may cost more than we realise

image.altText: A composite image of Thai beauty queen Panadda Wongphudee and Cambodian military spokeswoman Maly Socheata.

props.synopsis: A deadly border clash between Thailand and Cambodia has devolved into a fierce online propaganda war with fake news flying on both sides.

title.children: 'She is more beautiful': Thailand enlists beauty queen into border conflict

image.altText: A man and a woman in snow gear stand on skis in the mountains.

props.synopsis: Two cross-country skiers who were forced to spend a night in a blizzard following equipment failure warn other adventurers to be prepared for anything.

title.children: Preparation saves skiers who spent night in blizzard after gear failure

image.altText: Coral on a sub-tropical island, showing different colours.

props.synopsis: Researchers hope studies into the health of Lord Howe Island's remote reef will help experts better understand how marine systems are adapting to changing oceans.

title.children: World's most southern coral reef slowly recovers after coral bleaching

image.altText: Hugh McCluggage and Lions celebrate goal against Fremantle 150825

props.synopsis: Brisbane becomes the second team to secure September football with a comprehensive 57-point drubbing of Fremantle.

title.children: Lions secure finals football with Dockers demolition in Perth

image.altText: Sydney Swans AFLW star Chloe Molloy bends over, yells and pumps her fists in celebration after a goal.

props.synopsis: Sydney Swans begin their AFLW campaign with a spirited win over Richmond thanks to starring performances from Chloe Molloy and debutant Zippy Fish.

title.children: Four goal blast from Chloe Molloy on AFLW return as Swans beat Tigers

image.altText: A female footballer has tears as she is embraced by her grandparents.

props.synopsis: Players from around the world make up the Palestinian women's national football team, but they are united in their vision to show their strength and push for freedom.

title.children: The Palestinian women's football team is playing for 'identity and resistance'

image.altText: Rathy, Logitha and Lolitta Barthlote

props.synopsis: A former Coalition immigration minister joins calls for the government to resolve the status of around 8,000 asylum seekers who arrived between 2012 and 2013 and remain in legal limbo.

title.children: Thousands of asylum seeker families left in bridging visa limbo

image.altText: Indigenous male dressed in cultural attire conducting a traditional smoking ceremony in Townsville.

props.synopsis: A North Queensland community remembers Bindal elder Uncle Alfred Smallwood Senior as a gentle leader who helped men of all ages turn their lives around.

title.children: A 'legend of his time' leaves behind a path of second chances

image.altText: Mud surrounds a collapsed rooftop.

props.synopsis: Devastating flash flooding has killed more than 200 people, with dozens still missing after heavy rains washed away villages in the remote regions of Kashmir.

title.children: Hundreds of people killed in flash floods in India and Pakistan

image.altText: Rowland stands in the prime minister's courtyard smiling.

props.synopsis: Attorney-General Michelle Rowland promises governments will "pull out all stops" to close loopholes being used by child abusers by the end of this year, just hours after saying it could take up to 12 months.

title.children: Government promises to 'pull out all stops' to close child abuser loophole this year

image.altText: a cut out blond girl is surrounded by colourful cut out fish.

props.synopsis: The French director is best known for his Oscar-winning film Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind. In his newest project, he team ups with his daughter, Maya.

title.children: Michel Gondry's new film was created to keep his daughter close

image.altText: Two police cars with a rounded building in the distance.

props.synopsis: The US state's Attorney General Brian Schwalb has argued in a new lawsuit that Mr Trump is going far beyond his power under the law.

title.children: Washington DC launches court challenge against Trump police takeover

image.altText: Woman looking downcast in an ABC studio

props.synopsis: Writers scheduled to appear at the event in central Victoria this weekend are refusing to turn up because of a code of conduct they believe limits freedom of speech.

title.children: Festival opening night gala cancelled as writers pull out over censorship fears

image.altText: A golden and black-furred rat with a white-tipped tail walks up a log with a fish in its mouth.

props.synopsis: After a nail-biting countdown, the rakali — or 'Australian water rat' — is crowned the nation's most underrated animal, with the palm cockatoo and the cuttlefish nabbing a podium finish.

title.children: Rakali crowned Australia's most underrated animal, beating palm cockatoo and cuttlefish

image.altText: A man in a suit and tie stands outside the Supreme Court

props.synopsis: The fake submissions included fabricated quotes from a speech to the state legislature and non-existent case citations purportedly from Victoria's Supreme Court.

title.children: Senior lawyer files AI-generated submissions in Victorian teen murder case

image.altText: A group poses for a photo on chairs in front of a row of national flags.

props.synopsis: The Pacific's leaders are grappling with Solomon Islands' contentious decision to block all outsiders from the region's most important annual meeting next month. So what does the episode say about how strategic competition is reshaping the region?

title.children: Why both China and Taiwan aren't welcome at the Pacific's top meeting next month

image.altText: A pile of bright plastic lies in water in front of a cityscape.

props.synopsis: Several countries voiced bitter disappointment as the talks unravelled, but said they were prepared for future negotiations — despite six rounds of talks over three years.

title.children: Landmark plastics treaty falls apart as nations fail to find consensus for pollution

image.altText: A large poster saying 'Justice for Kumanjayi White' laid on the lawn, with other protest posters and people surrounding.

props.synopsis: NT police have provided an update on their investigation into the Warlpiri man's death in custody in Alice Springs, saying it is at an "advanced state" but still waiting on a forensic pathology report.

title.children: Police say investigation into Kumanjayi White's death at 'advanced state'

image.altText: woman shopping for fry pan wearing a mask

props.synopsis: We look at the pros and cons of cast iron, stainless steel, and non-stick cookware to see what might suit your household best.

title.children: Cast iron, non-stick or stainless steel: Which cooking surface should you be using?
